raw.title: To Kill a Mockingbird
raw.author: Harper Lee
raw.summary: This classic novel explores themes of racism and injustice in a small Southern town through the eyes of a young girl named Scout Finch. Her father, Atticus Finch, serves as a moral compass and lawyer defending an innocent Black man accused of rape.

response.title: NUMBER THE STARS
response.author: LOIS LOWRY
response.summary: Although she’s most famous for her dystopian novel The Giver, Lowry’s 1989 novel Number the Stars focuses on the life of a Jewish family living in Copenhagen during World War II. In line 147:4, the Psalms declares that He [God] telleth the number of the stars; he calleth them all by their names. The quotation is also used for its connotations of the Star of David associated with Judaism.

response.title: THE SUN ALSO RISES
response.author: ERNEST HEMINGWAY
response.summary: More Ecclesiastes! This particular quotation is from 1:5, which states that The sun also ariseth, and the sun goeth down, and hasteth to his place where he arose. Hemingway’s modernist novel came out in 1926.
